channel.title: Mysql deleting replicated entries
channel.description:
I have a few entries that were duplicated..
For example, lets say...
user - id - x - y 0123 - 23 - 222 - 3333 0123 - 23 - 222 - 3333
I want to delete the duplicated entry but want to keep the original, how would you do this?

item.title: Mysql deleting replicated entries
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:1, topic:552642”]I have a few entries that were duplicated…

For example, lets say…

user - id - x - y
0123 - 23 - 222 - 3333
0123 - 23 - 222 - 3333

I want to delete the duplicated entry but want to keep the original, how would you do this?[/quote]

Honestly make your userid and id a primary key and do either a INSERT ON DUPLICATE_KEY or an UPDATE on userid and id so you do not have duplicate data.

Read full topic

item.title: Mysql deleting replicated entries
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

It’s non rs related, i just felt that I needed give an example
I shall research the ignore keyword, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Mysql deleting replicated entries
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

create a primary or at least unique index (wtf is user and id?) and when you are altering the table with that you can use the IGNORE keyword to have it remove the duplicates. should have had a key to prevent this in the first place tbh

Read full topic
